titles.title: Providing for consideration of a concurrent resolution providing for adjournment of the House and Senate for the Independence Day district work period.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-640, by Mr. Diaz-Balart.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 248.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
During the course of debate, Mr. Hayworth demanded that certain words of Mr. Obey be taken down.

The Chair reviewed the words in question and declared them to be unparliamentary. Unanimous consent was requested strike the words in question and objection was heard to the unanimous consent request.
Subsequently, by unanimous consent, Mr. Obey was permitted to proceed in order.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 248 - 166 (Roll no. 286).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/26/1996--Introduced. Makes it in order to consider a concurrent resolution in the House of Representatives providing for adjournment of the House and Senate for the Independence Day district work period.
